ai.summary: Cobbler Trail is a moderate-length hike in the UK, covering 8.4 km with varied terrain and a steady pace. Suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The route combines well-trodden paths through woodland with grassy slopes and rocky sections; footing can be uneven, with short ascents and descents. Weather can change rapidly, so be prepared.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight conditions before you go. Wear sturdy boots with good grip and stay on marked paths. Bring a map and/or GPS, compass, and a fully charged phone. Carry adequate water and snacks, plus a lightweight rain shell and extra layers. Tell someone your plan and expected return time; don't hike alone if possible. Be mindful of wildlife and seasonal closures.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Weather-appropriate layers and waterproof outer shell
Lightweight rain gear and sun protection (hat, sunscreen)
First aid kit and blister care
Mobile phone with offline maps and a portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) offer the best conditions in the UK. Hikes outside this window are possible but require extra caution for weather and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Cobbler Trail – 8.4 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Cobbler Trail, an 8.4 km moderate hike in the UK. Varied terrain, practical gear tips, and safety notes to help you plan your trip.
